answerText: The Mandarins [or Les Mandarins][10] A steamy romance with Nelson Algren inspired the central love affair of The Mandarins, which was written by this French novelist who is better known for non-fiction works like The Ethics of Ambiguity.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | VCU + Michigan State  | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, the Albert Camus stand-in Henri Perron edits the left-wing newspaper L'Espoir. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel in which Anne Debreuilh has an affair with the American writer Lewis Brogan during her involvement with a group of French intellectuals in the years after World War II.
